subject: Public Speaking
title: Nudge Theory and Subtle Persuasion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Nudge Theory and Subtle Persuasion usable.

hook.text: Organ donation rates differ by 80% between similar countries. The only difference: the default option on a form.

buildup.text: Nudge theory by Thaler and Sunstein shows small changes in how choices are presented massively shift behavior.

discovery.text: In speeches, nudges include anchoring (state a number first) and defaults (tell people what most do before asking).

twist.text: Nudges work because they bypass deliberate thinking. People follow the path of least resistance without realizing it.

climax.text: Ethical speakers use nudges for good. But the same tools work for manipulation. Awareness is the only defense.

punchline.text: The easiest path wins. Design it wisely.

quiz.question: Why do nudges work in persuasion?
options: They change choice architecture so people follow the path of least resistance
